dialogues.text: Yes, I do. Really well! We’1ll make it together, okay? Followed by a mother-daughter dance party... Paige nods with a big smile. A worried-looking little gir in braids watches them standing behind one of the Moms. JULES (cont'd) (to the girl) Hey Maddie, what’s up? (Maddie ducks behind her Mom)

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: Bipolar.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: OhmyGod. . (hugs Paige.) I love you big girl.  57.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAR DOOR SLAMS
dialogues.text: Jules hits the backseat hard.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: God! Taking the high road is exhausting! It’s 2013, are we really still critical of working Moms?! Seriously? Still? (to Ben) I'm sorry. That was all rhetorical. No need to respond.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Wasn't going to. As Ben pulls into traffic. Jules notices Candice has writ her back. CANDICE’S EMAIL Transfer Ben? Really? Why?

dialogues.speaker: JULES TYPES
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Too observant. Jules rubs her temples then turns her attention to the CT BOX next to her.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Oh! Ben, I want to stop at the warehouse. 480 Greenpoint. Ben moves into the LEFT LANE. JULES (cont'd) No, no, make a right. 9th to Hamilton to the Expressway.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I think we should take 4th to Flatbush. Much faster.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: It won’t be.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: By 12 minutes. At least. (sees her in the rearview) Can I try?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SUV sits in front of a block long warehouse with the letters CTF on the outside.  58.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: I apologize.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: No need. They both open their car doors at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Endless rows of shelving units. Workers on golf carts. An enormous table in the center where mostly Latina Female Workers fold the clothes, toss them in plastic bags and b them. Ben stands near the door, shaking hands with the Foreman, then catches Jules showing the Workers the photo on her iPhone. She then demonstrates what she wants by carefully folding the clothes herself and neatly placing them in ba She makes a joke and the women around the table laugh. Be can’t help but be impressed. SAMBA MUSIC BEGINS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. CTF’S MASSAGE ROOM - MUSIC CONTINUES The walls are covered in ethnic fabrics. The room is diml lit. Fiona lights a candle when there’s a KNOCK on the do

dialogues.speaker: FIONA
dialogues.text: It’s open. The DOOR OPENS, Ben stands tentatively in the hallway. FIONA (cont'd) Ben! Come on in.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (entering) Wow, didn’t expect this.

dialogues.speaker: FIONA
dialogues.text: I like to think of it as a little bit of paradise. Can I interest you in a back rub?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Oh, no, no thanks. I came by because I just found out I have to work late --  59.

dialogues.speaker: FIONA
dialogues.text: Awww... Then, no dinner tonight?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Sorry. I was really looking forward to it. Was hoping we could pick another night.

dialogues.speaker: FIONA
dialogues.text: Of course. Come sit down. Ben checks his watch, then sits in a comfy chair as Fiona lights another candle then sits on a stool at Ben’s feet. FIONA (cont'd) What about a foot massage?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (giggles, tries to resist) During office hours?

dialogues.speaker: FIONA
dialogues.text: That's kinda the point. (points to Ben’s feet) May I? Ben nods as Fiona slips off his shoes, then gently rolls socks down and off. Ben slides down a bit in his chair.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: It’s already pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: FIONA
dialogues.text: All I've done is take off your socks.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, no one’s ever done that better. (then, as she begins) Whoa! Fiona has placed oil in her hands and has taken Ben’s rig foot between her palms and massages it deeply. Ben’s dyin

dialogues.speaker: FIONA
dialogues.text: Try to relax. You can shut your eyes if you want. Ben nods, shuts his eyes as the massaging continues, the candles flicker and the Samba slows down. Wow... FIONA (cont'd) So when would you like to reschedule?  60.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: FIONA
dialogues.text: Can’t tomorrow. What about Saturday?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Good. Oh, God, this is enormously....satisfying. (opens one eye) What time should I pick you up?

dialogues.speaker: FIONA
dialogues.text: How’s noon? I love daytime dates.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Lunch. Perfect. It’s sooner.

dialogues.speaker: FIONA
dialogues.text: (laughs, then) So how’s it going? How’s Jules?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Her world’s a fascinating one to fall into. Hope I can help her.

dialogues.speaker: FIONA
dialogues.text: Help her?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: She works on all cylinders all the time. Doesn’t stop, doesn’t sleep...never see her eat. Maybe it’s good that I’m here, you know...

dialogues.speaker: FIONA
dialogues.text: (stops massaging for a sec) I knew you were gonna be a good guy. I knew it! Ben looks at Fiona, smiles. She massages him deeply. Oh b

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: This can’t be okay to do at work. He rests his head back, closes his eyes. The massaging ju gets better and better. Ben almost loses it - big moan. Just then, Davis opens the door, sees candlelight, hears moaning and Fiona hunched over him. Ben and Fiona both tu looking caught.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: Ohmygod! I’m sorry! Oh, jeez. Okay don’t stop. I’m leaving!  61. He can’t get out the door fast enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of the Interns have left for the day. Ben sits at hi desk, reviewing an apartment lease for Davis.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I don’t know, kid, this lease doesn’t look so hot to me. Three months security deposit? You must love the place.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: No, it’s horrible but I can get in this week.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: If you can keep looking I would. (looks up, notices a jittery Lewis) What’s up Lewis? I’ve never seen you so awake.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: I was just asked to deliver this huge order to Tribeca and I think it’s to Jay Z's apartment. I’m not kidding. Look -- it says, S. Carter, I’m a little freaked out.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I don’t know who that is but is this someone you'd like to impress?

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: This is a genius, Ben and he’s got the hottest chick in the game -- Beyonce could potentially answer the door.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Okay, I know who she is. Maybe you should put on a proper shirt, with a collar.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: Why, do I look bad?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: -- Dress to impress Lewis. Go in the closet, find a “boyfriend shirt” that fits. And try to bring the hair down.  62.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: (joining) Benjamin, I made some progress.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Very big day for the intern team.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: It was great, she yelled at me but-

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: -- She yells at me all the time too.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Hey, it was communication. The guys high five. Lewis re-enters, wearing a girl's “boyfriend shirt” -- shows himself to Ben.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: I'm possibly meeting Jay Z and or Beyonce and I’m in a blouse.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Wear it dude. It’s an improvement.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: (shocked at how good he looks ) Whoa. Big one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is nearly empty. Jules is working alone in her Conference Room, takes a bite of a slice of pizza. She notices Ben, way across the field of desks, also eating.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Typing slowly at his computer and eating a Subway. He not Jules approaching, carrying a pizza box and two bottles o beer. He wonders where she’s headed.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: (arrives at his desk) I hate eating alone.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: So do I. Jules offers Ben a beer, pulls up a chair.  63.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: I swiped these from the tech fridge.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Nice goin’. (toasts her) Cheers.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Want a slice?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Sure. Thanks. (treading lightly) I noticed a couple of hours ago you had a meeting with another possible CEO. Saw him arrive. How’d that go?

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Was going well until he called us, I believe the term he used was a “chick site.” Then I didn’t hear anything he said after that.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Nooo.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Apparently selling “clothes” makes us a chick site. I mean, really? How is this not legit?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Couldn’t agree more. I find that... surprising.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Sexism in business? Really? (takes a swig of her beer) What did you do for work Ben, before you retired?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I was a VP for Dex One.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: «+. Phone books?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I was in charge of printing, before that ran sales and advertising.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: So big jobs... (Ben nods) Wait, wasn’t this a factory that (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULES (cont'd) made phone books..? (Ben smiles...) No! What? This is where you worked?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: For almost forty years. (Jules can’t believe it) For twenty-some years I sat right by that window. That was my office. It was up a few steps back then. I could look out over the whole factory. Our printing presses were in that corner. That's why the floor dips back there.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Nooooo....

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I know everything about this building. Or used to. You know the Sycamores out front?

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Yeah, I love them.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I remember the day they were planted.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: (wipes a tear) Is it totally weird being back here?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: No, feels like home. Remodeled but home.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: (takes a sip of beer, notices Ben’s screen) So you’re on Facebook, huh?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Well, I’m trying to figure it out. I joined ten minutes ago.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Better late than never. Want some help?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I’d love some but, really, you don’t have to waste your time.  65.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: -- I need a diversion. You have a photo of yourself?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: No, do I need one?

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: (takes out her phone) If you want to find all those hotties from high school. Hold on. (takes Ben’s photo, looks at it) Cute. I’1l send it to you. Okay, now there’s these questions for your profile that you can answer if you want or not. (scans them) Religious beliefs, political beliefs, people who inspire you...

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Jules Ostin. (Jules shoots him a look) I’m not trying to brown-nose you, but I’ve been in business a long time and have never run across anyone quite like you. You do inspire, Jules.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: You know what? I just knew a woman at the end of the day with a glass of wine and a laptop had real shopping potential. And if we actually promise her things would fit...

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: See -- that’s what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: (changing subject, reads his screen) Okay do you have a favorite quote?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I do. You're never wrong to do the right thing.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Who said that -- you?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Yes, but Mark Twain said it first. Jules laughs as she types the quote into Ben’s profile.  66.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Favorite music?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Oh, jeez. Sam Cooke -- one my all time faves. Love Miles Davis, Billie Holiday...

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: She was great, huh? Hold on... (goes on iTunes) What’s your favorite song of hers?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: These Foolish Things. Jules buys the song and it BEGINS.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Transports you, doesn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Every time.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Okay. Books?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Love Clancy. Ludlum. Crazy about Harry Potter.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: (types those in) Matt loves Harry Potter too. JULES (cont'd) What about your status? Married, single...?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Widower.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Oh, I’m sorry. I think we should say single then... Okay, now you know what you need? (Ben looks to her) Someone to friend.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I’ll be friends with the other interns. They’1ll show me how to do it the morning.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: You can friend me.  67.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Thank you. Jules types in her name and confirms.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Okay, congrats -- you’re now part of the Facebook generation. (finishes her beer, rises) I’ve got about another hour of work. You good with that?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Of course. This was great, Jules.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Yeah, nice to have an adult conversation with an adult man. You know what I mean, not about work and not about...

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I know what you mean. Jules nods and awkwardly waves, heading back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SUV pulls quietly in front of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules is out cold in the backseat and making a racket -- snoring. Ben doesn’t know if he should wake her. He sits, waits, tries not to listen but it’s SO LOUD. Another car passes and Jules startles awake.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Oh. We’re here. Oh... (straightens up) Sorry. Was I snoring?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: No, no, just sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Oh, then I was snoring. Sorry about that. You know my parents are sleep researchers and they’ve studied my sleep my whole life. (gathering her things) Apparently my REM is all screwed up or the ratio of my flow-volume curve and my... (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULES (cont'd) (stops herself, then...) Fun gettin’ to know me, right?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: It is. You need some help back there?

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: No, I’m good. (Ben Exits, Jules lets herself out - they meet on the curb, she loses her balance, he catches her) Thank you. I never fall asleep in the car so that was actually amazing. Apologize about the racket.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Barely noticed.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: I'll pretend I believe you. (looks up at her house) I love this house. It’s gonna be great when we’re done. It just looks happy to me. Like if it was in a kid's book, it would make you feel good when you turned the page and saw it. Know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Well. (salutes) Sayonara.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Sayonara. Ben watches until Jules is safely inside the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules EXITS her bathroom in her pj’s,and slides into bed to Matt who is asleep. She turns toward Matt. He stirs.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Didn't hear you come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know... I was thinking... (Matt opens his eyes) We need some awake time together. Matt nods, kisses her. Just what she needed. JULES (cont'd) Yeah...and that too. 69. Matt kisses her more deeply. Her eyes fill up as she kiss him back and they begin to make love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules EXITS her front door and sees the SUV waiting at th curb. She squints at Ben, wondering why he didn’t ring th bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules get in, cheerier than we’ve seen her before.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: ‘Morning. Doris, one of the other new Senior Interns, sits behind t wheel and turns to Jules.

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: Good morning. I’m Doris. They asked me to drive you today. All set back there? Seat belt fastened?

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Where’s Ben?

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: Somebody said he got transferred. You know the best way to get to headquarters? Without looking, Doris PULLS INTO THE STREET, a car swerv around her HONKING. DORIS (cont'd) Hold your horses, maniac! (turns back to Jules) Which way, hon? I’m all turned around here. HONNNKKKKK .  70.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: Walking through the office on her cell.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: You told me to transfer him!

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Doris is in the backseat.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: (into her phone) -- That was 2 days ago! Why didn’t you check with me?

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: First of all, it was yesterday...

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Where is he, do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben is waiting at the “pick up” end of the counter, stand between two other office-schleppers. This recent turn of events has left him looking and feeling uncomfortable. His name is called and he’s handed two take out trays of coffee. Just as he takes them, he looks across the crowde shop and spots Jules rushing through the door.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: (sees Ben, crosses to him) You must think I’m demented.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Not the word I'd use, but I was a little surprised when I got the call. Jules, I apologize if I overstepped in some way...

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: -- No, no, no. No, don’t apologize. You did nothing wrong. Look, I have a lot going on, and I’m a really private person and at first, I don’t know, I thought maybe this wasn’t going to work but I was wrong. Let me take one of those. (takes one of the trays)

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Jules, no explanation necessary.  71.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: No, actually one is, Ben, ‘cause I’m usually better than this. The truth is, something about you makes me feel calm or more centered or Zen, and I can use that. Obviously. I hope you'll accept my apology and come back to work. For me. If you would.... (Ben almost hesitates) And I’m not just saying this because I screwed up but I was thinking this morning, I’d like to move you up to my area, next to Becky. I know you can handle more work, if you'd like more. God, I really hate that I jumped the gun and made you feel--

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I’m happy to come back.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Thank you. (catches her breath) That’s great. Can I give you a lift back to the office?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: (as they walk away together ) You mind driving? I don’t actually have a license.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason and Kiko are adding a new DESK right next to Becky is freaking out. Ben ARRIVES holding his briefcase, keybo a few files and things.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: -- This is crazy Ben. Two desks are not going to fit in here.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I promise to stay out of your way.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: That’s impossible, I have no room to-- (shuts up when Jules

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Hi. This is good, right? I like this arrangement. Becky, I want you to let Ben give you a hand, okay? And cc him on all my e-mails. (Becky nods) Did we get yesterday’s numbers?

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Yes. We did. I saw them here. Becky looks all over her messy desk. Can’t find them. Ben spots the sheet with the numbers and indicates to Becky w it is with his eyes. Becky follows, hands them to Jules. BECKY (cont'd) Here you go.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Thanks. Also, I need to go over the data on the customer purchase patterns. Let Ben take a look at that too. Actually let Ben take a look at it first. (This throws Becky) Don’t worry Beck. Back up’s good. Ping me when Candice gets in. Jules heads off. As soon as she’s out of sight, Becky bre down in tears. Ben motions for Jason to go to her. Jason nervously walks to Becky and she collapses into him. He p his arms around her, thrilled but not sure what to say.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Becky. .?

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: (turning to Ben) I’ve been here 9 months, Ben, and she’s never asked me to take a look at anything for her. Ever. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I hear ya. That’s frustrating.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Totally! I went to Penn, I have a business degree but I never seem to do anything right around here and you're like 50 years older than me and deaf and... (collapses into Jason - he’s so happy)

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (sneaks Jason his hanky) I happen to think you do a lot of things right.  73.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: (offering Becky the hanky) You do. So much.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: (using the hanky) I know that, but she doesn’t. I bust my ass for her 14 hours a day. She never notices. Ohmygod, I hate girls that cry at work. (backs away from Jason) Breaking news... my life sucks!

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: How about if you, just as an experiment, try letting me help you. A lot of your stress is going to be lifted once you're out from under this mountain of work. (She starts to say something) And maybe you should consider leaving here at a normal hour once in a while, see your friends, have a little fun.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: I can offer my assistance in this area. Would love to actually.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: I just don’t want her to think I can’t do my job and need an “intern” to help me.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Okay... you’re not going to want to hear this, but I heard women who sleep less than 7 hours a night gain 38% more weight than women who sleep more than 7 hours a night.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: (sobbing now) What?! I leave here every night at 11, I'm back at 7, I sleep like 5 hours a night. Now I’m going to get fat?!!

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (indicating her stack of work) Let's get through this stuff. Let’s do it together. Let’s clean slate it. Jason pats her arm just to punctuate.  74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules, Candice and a small group are intently huddled aro a LAP TOP. They’re watching a live CTF MAP of the U.S. th shows purchases as they happen. Icons of Shopping Bags po in Miami, Tuscon, Chicago, etc.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: (watching a sale) Thank you St. Louis.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Okay, look at Chicago, she put the same boots in her cart as the woman in Houston. Let’s see what she does at check out. What?! She’s not buying them either. Check the delivery costs on those boots, will you? Why aren’t they selling? Ben gently knocks on the open door. Jules turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I took a look at the data purchase patterns... Shall I come back?

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: No, no, come on in. That was fast.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Well, I enlisted Becky’s help. Seems the most expensive place you're advertising is actually bringing you the customers who are spending the least and the channels you're least investing in are adding enormous value in segments that currently appear to have low value but actually have the highest spending potential... (everyone stares in awe) That’s what I could tell. So far.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Whoa. Ben! Could you like deal with all that for me? Maybe come up with a better plan? I mean, if you have the time.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Happy to. Candice loves that Jules is delegating. She smiles at Jul

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: The man spent 40 years in business.  75.

dialogues.speaker: CANDICE
dialogues.text: I get it.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: And Jules. Becky was a huge help in this. You know she has a business degree from Penn.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: I know. I mean, I forgot, but I know. (Ben doesn’t let her off the the hook) I'll say something to her.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: That’1l be major. (Ben exits) The Women in the room, just watch after him. Loving him. A LARGE DUFFEL LANDS NEAR BEN’S DESK - LATER DAVIS O.S. How’s it goin’ up here in first class?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (sending off an e-mail) Busy. I see you found an apartment.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: Nope. My two weeks were up. I’m moving in with my cousin.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Excellent.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: In Philadelphia.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Davis!

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: What? It’s only for a few weeks. I’ll get there by eleven, leave at five. That’s cool. I can do it.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I feel like everybody’s uncle around here...

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: Why?  76.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Because I’m going to save your ass, and put you up for a few weeks...obviously. Davis grabs Ben, hugs him, kisses him on the cheek. Then kisses him again. BEN (cont’d) Okay, okay... Easy fella... INT. BEN’S DEN - THAT NIGHT Ben is in a recliner, wearing pjs and a robe and Davis is the couch in sweats. They’re watching Sports Center.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: You got the life here, dude. You’re a great cook. You got a dream house. Big TV’s in every room. A backyard. You got it made. (Ben doesn’t answer) Ben? Still no answer. Davis sits up, stares at Ben. He can onl see him from the side. DAVIS (cont'd) You okay? (stands) Ben! Yo! (no response from Ben) Hey, look! Fiona’s here! She's totally naked! She’s.... Still nothing. Davis looks at Ben’s hand, which has falle limply at his side. DAVIS (cont'd) Ohmygod. Davis nervously steps away from the couch, moves closer t Ben -- runs his hand in front of Ben’s nose and mouth. Doesn't feel a thing. DAVIS (cont'd) (screams )

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Ben jerks awake. Davis leaps back, grabbing his heart. DAVIS (cont'd) Oh, fu--! Thank God! You’re alive!

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: -- What is wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You scared me. We were talking, drinking beers and then suddenly radio silence. And your hand looked so out of it.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, Davis. I dozed off. If I die, you’ll know.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: Very funny. And obviously I won't, but... Oh, man, am I relieved. I am not the right person to find a dead body.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I'm starting to understand why your parents kicked you out. I’m going to hit the hay. Do not check on me.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: I won’t, I promise, but can I sit in the recliner or is that like off limits for anyone but..

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: -- Be my guest. (rises, notices something on the table) Why would you put your beer next to the coaster?

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: (moving it onto the coaster) You're right. I’m sorry. So where are the master quarters? Just so I know in case of any... (off Ben’s look) It wasn’t on the tour. I’m curious. INT. BEN’S BEDROOM The Boys admire the well made bed.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: I like that you do the throw pillow thing.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I was married for a very long time.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: Whoa! Is that your closet?  78. The Boys ENTER BEN’S CLOSET. Organized, color coordinated and bigger than you'd think. DAVIS (cont'd) Busy man about town! What is in all these drawers?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Boxers, t-shirts, pocket squares, handkerchiefs...

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: Okay, what's the deal with the handkerchief? That one I just don’t get, at all.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: It’s essential. That your generation doesn’t know that is criminal. The best reason to carry a handkerchief is to lend it. Ask Jason about this. Women cry, Davis. We carry it for them. One of the last vestiges of the chivalrous gent. (Davis is enamoured) I know you want to hang, but I have to go to sleep, kid. I’m pooped. (pats Davis shoulder) ‘Sleep tight.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: Night Ben. Thank you! (hugs him hard) Will you wake me in the morning or is that asking too much? My parents always--

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Too much. The Boys EXIT IN DIFFERENT DIRECTIONS as Ben turns out th lights. We stay in the dark..

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Understood. I’1l set the alarm on my phone... I just hope I hear it. I’m a deep...

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: --OhmyGod. I’11 wake you!

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Thank you. Love you! Not kidding.  79. INT. JULES & MATT’S KITCHEN - THE NEXT A.M. Matt is packing Paige’s lunch. Paige and Ben sit side-by- side at the island, eating pancakes. A few work folders s by Ben’s plate.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: (to Ben) Can you pour me more syrup please? (Ben pours) Perfect. Good job. Ben and Matt laugh as Jules ENTERS.

dialogues.speaker: JULES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh, boy! (fixing herself coffee) Okay, so this really big CEO named Townsend, the one everyone said would never be interested in us, because we weren’t big enough for him...

dialogues.speaker: MATT/BEN
dialogues.text: (at the same time) -- Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: We're like your sister-wives.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: (laughs, then) Well, we just found out -- he’s beyond interested.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Exciting. Ben looks from Matt to Jules. Jules and Ben connect for a split second.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Yeah, maybe. Everyone’s flipping out, but you know I’m still on the fence at best, but anyway, only thing is, I have to go to San Francisco to meet him. He can’t get here.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: (handing her pancakes) When do you have to go?

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: The only day he could meet is next Thursday. Want to come? Maybe we could stay for the weekend?  80.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: (looks at fridge calendar) Sounds good but... I can’t. Paige is snack leader on Thursday and I’m supposed to be in the class with her. It’s kind of a big deal.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Right. No, I forgot.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Maybe Ben could go with you.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Dat’s a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Guys, Ben has a life.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: -- Not really. (Jules looks over at him) Not one that takes me to San Francisco. If you want the company, I’d love to go.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Definitely.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: Guess what Ben? Today my Dad is going to be Ariel, it’s his turn.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: That’s good, right?

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: You think finding a CEO is a big deal? Here the big negotiation is about who gets to be Ariel when we play Little Mermaid and, just for the record, it’s never been my turn. This is huge. I get to comb my hair with a fork... play with gadgets and gizmos a-plenty... Paige giggles as Jules looks lovingly at Matt, almost tea eyed. Ben picks up on this, smiles to himself when Jules’ phone RINGS and breaks the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben, behind the wheel. Jules on SPEAKER PHONE with Candic  81.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: -- So guys how long ‘til we get it fixed? I mean, if you can’t zoom in, you probably won’t buy. Ben nods, agreeing. They exchange looks in the rear view. CANDICE 0O.S. First couple of hours are already down 23%.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Oh, boy.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: I'll be there in like...

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: -- Six minutes. CANDICE 0O.S. We’re on it.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Ben, do you have the info on the friends shopping together... Ben hands Jules a folder as her 2nd CELL RINGS. She quick answers as she peruses the folder. JULES (cont'd) This is Jules.

dialogues.speaker: JULES'S MOM
dialogues.text: (on Speaker) What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Oh, Mom. Hi. Oh, I just found out the zoom link...the button you click on to zoom in on a photo isn’t working.

dialogues.speaker: JULES'S MOM
dialogues.text: That doesn’t sound like a big deal.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Actually it is... it’s how people get a closer look at what they’re buying. Everyone zooms in.

dialogues.speaker: JULES'S MOM
dialogues.text: -- Oh, I guess I don’t go to your website enough to know that. Jules makes an incredulous face at the phone, then starts typing an e-mail to Matt as her other phone RINGS  82.

dialogues.speaker: JULES'S EMAIL
dialogues.text: Matt -- Question. Why is my mother always such a raging bitch?

dialogues.speaker: JULES'S MOM
dialogues.text: Typing and ringing....

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: (looking at 2nd phone) Yeah, sorry. It’s the warehouse. Can I call you back Mom?

dialogues.speaker: JULES'S MOM
dialogues.text: No need.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Okay. Love you.

dialogues.speaker: JULES'S MOM
dialogues.text: Yep. Ben’s eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: (to herself) Who says yep to I love you? Ben can’t disagree on that one. Jules continues her e-mai

dialogues.speaker: JULES'S E-MAIL
dialogues.text: She’s seriously f-ed up. How did I turn out so normal? (she adds an - “ish” to normal, answers phone)

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Hey Alonzo.

dialogues.speaker: LATINO VOICE
dialogues.text: Jules, I have not good news.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Lay it on me.

dialogues.speaker: LATINO VOICE
dialogues.text: In a routine check by the sanitation department, they found one bed bug in the warehouse.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Noooo!

dialogues.speaker: ALONZO
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, yes. We sent out 4800 boxes yesterday. We have to (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALONZO (cont'd) get them all back, shut down the warehouse, spray for bedbugs, then we can start shipping again.

dialogues.speaker: JULES /BEN
dialogues.text: Nightmare! As Ben pulls up in front of CTF, Jules grabs her bag then realizes she didn’t send Matt her e-mail about her Mom. S types in M for the start of Matt’s name, looks out the wi at CTF and INSTEAD OF CLICKING on MATT’S E-MAIL ADDRESS, accidentally, clicks on MOM’S E-MAIL ADDRESS. Distracted, she PUSHES SEND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules, walking hyper-fast through the office. Ben is a fe paces behind her. Suddenly, she STOPS, senses she might h done something awful.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: No no no no no! Jules looks at her phone, checks her last SENT E-mail and SEES SHE ACCIDENTALLY SENT the “My mother's such a bitch” mail to her Mother. She GASPS, looks up as Ben joins her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least 20 Techies are scrambling into the room for an emergency meeting. Jules paces at the head of the room, washing her hands with Purell. Ben stands to the side as Candice and Becky join.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: I know the Zoom’s broken and I don’t mean to take anyone off of that but... I need a favor. I, accidentally sent an e-mail to the wrong person and she’s at work right now and I know she doesn’t check her personal e-mail until she gets home at 5:30, so I have until then to figure out how to delete it because if this person sees this e- mail, it’ll be...horrible and on top of that, she has a slight heart condition and I think this could possibly be not good for that, so, I'm relying on your good graces and brilliance to figure out how to save my ass. (a few laughs) Please tell me there’s a way.  84.

dialogues.speaker: TECHIE
dialogues.text: Are you two on the same server?

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: I’m on gmail she’s on Earthlink. Mumbles from the crowd. Earthlink?? JULES (cont'd) Okay, whatever. The Guys talk amongst themselves. Argue it out.

dialogues.speaker: TECHIE
dialogues.text: Truthfully Jules, it’s pretty impossible to hack into a server. (Jules sinks)

dialogues.speaker: TECHIE
dialogues.text: And you definitely don’t know her password?

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: No idea. Ben crosses to the front of the room, joins Jules, turnin her away from the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I think there’s only one thing you can do.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: What? Tell me. I’m dying.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I think me and the boys take off, break into your Mom’s house and steal her computer.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Break in and steal her computer?!! Are you kidding me?! (He's not) That’s fucking genius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules's SUV makes its way into a suburban neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: GPS VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Turn right in 300 yards.  85.

dialogues.speaker: SAME TIME
dialogues.text: Ben’s driving. Jason is next to him. In the backseat, Dav and Lewis. Davis is now wearing a tie, a la Ben.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Little does GPS Lady know she’s an accomplice to a crime.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: The woman has a heart condition, think of it as a good deed.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: I never thought you’d be a bad influence on me, Whittaker.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Relax fellas, this is going to be painless. The key is under a flower pot, we go in, we delete, we disappear.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: She doesn’t have an alarm, right?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: No she does not.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: And what if we need a password to get onto her e-mail. Then what?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Then we take the computer. Jules said she'd buy her a new one so it’s a win/win.

dialogues.speaker: GPS VOICE
dialogues.text: You have reached your destination in 100 yards.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: This is like an Oceans movie. Ben’s the older guy in the big glasses...

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Elliot Gould. Come on...

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: Jason -- you’re Clooney.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Thank you.  86.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: I’m Matt Damon ‘cause I’m kind of an outsider.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: Who am I?

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: You're Ben Affleck’s brother.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: Why aren’t I Brad Pitt?

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: I think that’s self explanatory.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Okay, Clooney, you’re behind the wheel. Keep the engine running and your eyes open. Damon, Affleck’s brother, you’re with me. Three car doors open at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: TOO MANY FLOWER POTS
dialogues.text: Sit at the back door. The Boys start lifting them all. Da finds the key. The KEY IS INSERTED into the LOCK. As soon as the Boys EN THE KITCHEN, they hear a BEEPING SOUND. They look around, SPOT AN ALARM KEYPAD on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: Great plan so far. Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Davis, call Becky. Davis quickly dials, hands his phone to Ben.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: If we don’t know the code, this is going to turn into an alarm in 60 seconds.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (into phone) Becky, put Jules on, it’s-- (can’t believe it) -- She put me on hold. What is wrong with that girl?

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: (starts to panic) This is so not good. What are we supposed to do?  87.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Start looking for the computer. (they go off together) Separately! (into Phone) -- Becky! Don’t screw around. Put Jules on, it’s an emergency. Interrupt her! (wipes his brow) Jules! Your mother has an alarm. Yes she does, I’m in her kitchen and it’s about to go off. What’s the code?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: rushing outside of the Conference Room, on her cell

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: I have no idea. Ben, listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: BACK AT THE HOUSE
dialogues.text: Davis ENTERS THE KITCHEN, without the computer. Shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: -- I know this woman, trust me, that’s a fake alarm she bought from some infomercial or something. It’s not connected. It’s just to scare off burglars.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: (freaking out) It’s doing a good job.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: My parents would never pay for a burglar alarm,. They’re the cheapest people in America.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (maybe believing her) It hasn’t turned into an alarm yet...still beeping.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: -- That's cause it’s a fake. Trust me on this. Have you found the computer? Lewis re-enters, empty handed.  88. CAMERA FOLLOWS as they all RUSH UP THE STAIRS, in and out Bedrooms. Then:

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Found it!

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Got it! Both guys ARRIVE in the UPSTAIRS HALLWAY, holding laptops

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (into phone) We found two. Which one is hers? The white one or the silver one?

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: (trying to remember) White one or silver one? White one or silver one? I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: (joining) Your Mom’s computer? It’s white. (Jules hesitates) I got it fixed for her once. I’m positive.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: The white one! Lewis hands the white computer to Ben. Just then the ALAR GOES OFF FULL BLAST. JULES (cont'd) Oh my God!

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: I knew there was no such thing as a fake alarm! We’re getting arrested. That’s it. We’re dead. Our fingerprints are all over this place.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Ben, do you see the e-mail? Ben is now in a chair, the computer on a table next to hi

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (opening the computer) Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: Double time it dude! Lewis takes over at the computer.  89.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: Found it! (reads ) Why 1s my mother always such a raging bitch? Subject: She’s A Terrorist. Ben reacts to the e-mail.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Yes! Delete it!

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: It’s gone.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Now from the trash. As Lewis deletes from the trash, we hear a POLICE SIREN. the Guys look up.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Davis, where’d you find this?

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: Under the bed. Right side. Lewis takes off with the computer, comes right back.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: Which right side?

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: Right side facing the bed. (Lewis exits) Oh, God, we’re so screwed. My life is over. I’m going to be a felon and I haven’t even committed a crime. You’re old, Whittaker, they’11l let out for good behavior, but the rest of us--

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Davis! Pull it together. Can’t you hear how far away that is. We’ve got at least 30 seconds until they’re here.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: It takes you 30 seconds to stand up! No offense, but fast is not one of your speeds. How will I explain this to my parents? They will not get breaking and--

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Twenty seconds.  90. Davis FLIES OUT OF FRAME as Lewis returns. All three run down the stairs as fast as they can.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Is listening to Lil Wayne very LOUDLY. He’s looking out h window away from the house oblivious to the siren.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND HIM WE SEE
dialogues.text: Lewis, Davis and Ben, SPRINTING to the car. When they reach the car, the doors are LOCKED. They bang the car doors. Jason doesn’t react. Davis THROWS HIMSELF the hood of the car.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: Open the fucking doors!!!!1!! Jason LEAPS, flips the unlock door switch. The Guys jump Davis has to slide off the hood and run to catch up.

dialogues.speaker: 5 TEQUILA SHOTS
dialogues.text: Five hands ENTER FRAME and lift them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules and the Four Guys take the Tequila shots. It’s not for any of them.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: (to Ben) You're a crazy son-of-a-bitch, you know that?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I didn’t actually. I’m sure my blood pressure was through the roof, but... (sucks on his lime) --it was worth it.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Guys, I can’t, literally can’t, thank you enough for what you just did. It was so above and beyond and brave and loyal! I’m indebted to you forever. (to Bartender) I‘1l have another. (to Guys) Anybody else?  gl. Jason and Lewis nod.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: Sure. (to Bartender) But can I just get a half this time? The Bartender shoots him a look and pours him aa half a shot. Ben watches Jules throw hers back and then quickly her lime wedge.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Jules!

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: I know. I can drink. It’s a thing about me. So what are your names again? I never want to not know you.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: I’m Jason. I’ve worked for you about a year. I’ve delivered things to your home. I’ve met Matt a bunch of times. I tied your daughter’s shoe once.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Of course I’ve seen you around, I just didn’t know your name. (to Davis) And you're new, right?

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: Yeah. I’m Davis, I started the same day as Ben. We’re pretty much besties and I’m also his mentee. He gave me this tie for example. It was his. It’s vintage. Ben shakes his head, although amused.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: I like it. Love men in ties. And you're Lewis. I could hear a little over the phone. You were very cool under pressure.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: It was my first heist but I tried to be chill. Thanks for noticing.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Boys, what can I say? Sorry, didn’t mean to call you boys. No one calls men “men” anymore. Have you (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULES (cont'd) noticed? Women went from Girls to Women and men went from Men to Boys. This is a problem. In the big picture. Know what I mean? (They don’t. She indicates one more drink to Bartender )

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Another? You sure about that?

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Yup. Here’s my theory about this - we all grew up during the “Take your Daughter to Work Day” thing, right? (they nod, although they’re not sure) So we were always told we could do anything, be anything. And I think somehow the boys got, maybe not left behind but not quite as nurtured. We had Oprah, you know. I wonder sometimes how guys fit in...they seem to still be trying to figure it all out. Still dressing like little boys, still playing video games. (takes her next shot) As she sucks on her lime, Ben wishes she’d slow down.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Oh, boy...

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Here’s another thing. You ever notice how the husband on every commercial on TV is always such a dope? Has it always been that way or is the “husband” the new dumb blonde? In one generation men went from guys like Al Pacino and Harrison Ford to... She pauses as she indicates the Guys who wish they weren’ standing there in T-shirt and hoodies. JULES (cont'd) Look at Ben here. A dying breed... Look and learn ‘cause if you ask me... (points to Ben) This is what cool is.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Thanks Ace. You’re not going to drink anymore, right?  93.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: I mean... calling me Ace... Super- cool, right? Okay, I’m officially a little dizzy, haven’t eaten. I apologize for the tirade. I’m gonna have to go but I’m forever in your debt, gentlemen... another word that’s never used anymore. Let’s bring it back, shall we? Ben, I'll be Uber-ing home. She starts to tip over. Ben catches her. JULES (cont'd) And that is what a gentleman does for a lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules is just finishing throwing up in a trash can as Ben holds back her hair.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Achhh. I’m so sorry. I’m fine now... (throws up again) Oh, God... Ben hands Jules his handkerchief. She wipes her mouth. JULES (cont'd) Haven’t done that since college. Thank you... Oh, man... (looks at Ben) You know what you are...?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Uh, no.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: You are an actual wonderful person. And I don’t know many of those. (Ben appreciates this but seems more concerned with how she is) Very sorry you had to see this. Humiliating.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: It’s all good. You feelin’ any better?

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Yeah. I’m good now. I’m fine.  94. She cleans her hands with Purell then extends her hand to Ben. He shakes it. Jules can’t help herself, she folds in him, leans on him, resting her head on his chest. She doesn’t move. JULES (cont'd) Leaving in a minute. Just working on making this the worst night possible for you... (finally pulls away)

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Not at all. (she looks up to him...) You've had a stressful day. A Town Car pulls up.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: How is it you always manage to say the right thing, do the right thing, be the right thing? It’s uncanny. (with a gentle salute) Thank you and......

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (salutes her) Sayanora.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Absolutely. Ben nods as Jules ducks into the cab and it takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amongst the Saturday shoppers, we find Ben and Fiona. Ben in a suit, Fiona, in a dress and heels. Ben’s walk is noticeably more jaunty.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Really so nice of you to do this. Most women would have just rescheduled.

dialogues.speaker: FIONA
dialogues.text: Not to worry. I understand. They stop at their destination.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: It was unexpected. Fiona nods as they turn and ENTER a FUNERAL HOME.  95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Fiona make their way down the center aisle. There lot of elbowing going on so all can take a gander. Ben and Fiona take seats next to Ben’s friend Miles. Mile checks out Fiona.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (tickled) Benjie, you brought a date to a funeral! Unreal.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: We had plans. Who knew this was going to -- Miles leans over Ben and shakes Fiona’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: How do you do? I’m Miles.

dialogues.speaker: FIONA
dialogues.text: Hello. Fiona. So sorry for your loss.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: (seeing only her cleavage) Thank you dear. (to Ben) Wowza. Fiona obviously heard this. Ben looks at her, embarrassed then is startled when he catches Patty Pomerantz directly across the aisle staring him down. Just then the REAR DOORS TO THE CHAPEL OPEN and the caske wheeled into the room, down the center aisle, and past th mourners. Everyone stands. Ben lets out a sigh. Fiona takes his hand. Ben looks back at Patty who hasn’t taken her ey off of him. He offers her a small “don’t hate me” smile. raises her middle finger and starts to say the Fu-- of Fu You as the casket moves past and blocks her words. Once t casket passes, her finger comes down but we get the messa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Fiona turn a corner from a residential street ont street lined with shops. Fiona holds a pink bakery box. Fiona I never went to a shiva before. The laughter was wonderful and I don’t think I’ve ever eaten more... I’m not even sure how I left with a box of cookies.  96.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You were a big hit. Giving the widow that back massage -- winning move.

dialogues.speaker: FIONA
dialogues.text: She needed it.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I definitely think it’s a good idea to take all first dates toa funeral. Real ice breaker, don’t you think?

dialogues.speaker: FIONA
dialogues.text: I know you’re kidding but honestly, who needs the strain of the dinner date and the “Why aren’t you married” conversation. At our age it’s not even possible to catch up. Ben stops, letting others pass around them. Ben and Fiona stand face to face.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I can do me in ten seconds. Ready? Widower. One son. Two grand-kids. Spent my life manufacturing phone books which now no longer have a function. I’m currently working as an intern, havin’ a ball and best news is, I have a crush on a girl I met at work.

dialogues.speaker: FIONA
dialogues.text: (loves that, then) I’m sorry you lost your wife... Okay... (points to herself) Divorced. Three beautiful daughters. One grandchild, a boy, on the way. I was sick a few years back. I’m not anymore. I’m an in- house e-commerce masseuse. Love my job and I finally met a man I actually want to hang out with. CAMERA RISES as Ben and Fiona continue talking and sharin laugh, walking off together. DISSOLVE TO DUSK where Ben a Fiona cross a tree-lined residential street. Ben takes Fiona’s hand, she smiles at him as they walk away from us down the street, chatting, completely at ease with one another.  97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door OPENS to reveal Matt, in a robe, messy hair. He looks awful. He routinely hands Ben a mug of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (taking the coffee) Hey buddy, you don’t look so great.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Believe me, I look better than I feel. Do I feel hot to you?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (ENTERS, feels Matt’s forehead) Not too bad.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Good. I don’t want the girls to get this. You see the Knicks last night?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: They were on fire. O.S., we HEAR Paige CRYING. They ENTER THE KITCHEN. Paige sits on her regular counter stool, sobbing. Jules is tryi to get her to eat her oatmeal. Ben takes his seat next to Paige. BEN (cont’d) What’s with the waterworks, Little One?

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: I just told her the sitter’s going to have to take her to Maddie’s birthday party today ‘cause Matt’s sick...

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: (tearfully) -- But I don’t want to go with the sitter. Ben, can you take me? (between sobs) Please...?

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Awww, honey, I’m sorry, but Ben has to go to work today. Paige dramatically throws her head down on the counter, sobbing. Her little shoulders shake. Ben can’t take it.  98.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Jules, come on, it’1l take an hour. (whispers ) Lemme take her... Matt indicates -- let him do it. Jules feels badly asking but...

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (driving, mid-argument ) -- I can’t believe we’re still going through this. I’m going the right way. Please, have a little trust.

dialogues.speaker: THE BACK SEAT
dialogues.text: Paige is in her car seat, looks up from her toy computer.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: But the park where the party is-- (looks outside) Oh, actually this is it. (returns to computer)

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) Like a clone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dozen Moms and their 4 Year Olds. Ben arrives holding Paige’s hand and carrying a gift. The Moms who gave Jules hard time at school are all here and silently comment to another about Paige’s escort.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (whispers to Paige) Which one is Maddie?

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: (whispers ) The one in the pink. Ben looks over at a group of kids and sees Ten Little Gir huddled together all wearing pink. PAIGE (cont'd) You can sit with the other Moms, okay?  99.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Okay. Want to give Maddie her present? Paige rushes off as Ben joins the Moms on the benches. BEN (cont’d) Hi. I’m Ben, I’m helping Matt and Jules out today.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Oh, are you Matt’s Dad?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: No, no, I work for Jules. One of the Mom’s mumbles to another -- that can’t be fun. BEN (cont’d) (catching her drift) Hmmm?

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Oh, nothing, I’ve heard she’s, you know, kind of “tough.” (the Other Moms agree)

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Tough? Jules? She’s a total bad ass. Guess that’s how she became an internet sensation. (sees Women are uncomfortable) Must make you proud, huh? One of your own out there every day crashing the glass ceiling of the tech world. So -- bravo! Good for her. Right?

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: (eating shit) Yeah...no...for sure. Ben raises his fist in solidarity. Paige runs to Ben, cud up next to him.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: What’s up kiddo?

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: I don’t feel good.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Want to sit on my lap? Paige nods. Ben lifts her onto his lap, feels her forehea  100.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: If she’s sick, she probably shouldn’t be here. MOM #2's Daughter heads for Paige. Her Mom grabs her arm, yanks her back.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Tough crowd, Paigey. Should we hit the road?

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: Does that mean leave?

dialogues.speaker: PARK SLOPE
dialogues.text: Paige now seems fine and energetic as they drive down Jul street.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: I spy with my little eye...something... blue!

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Is it the car next to us?

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Is it that dog leash?

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Is it the sky?

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: Yes! You got one! Your turn Ben. As Ben nears the house, he SEES Matt, looking entirely be and bounding down the front steps in a GREEN T-SHIRT.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Okay, I have a good one. I spy with my little eye - something green...

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: (looking the opposite way, yawns ) Is it that tree?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Nope.  101.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: Is it that front door? Well, that’s kinda green. Ben watches as Matt SMILES AND WAVES TO SOMEONE IN A WAIT SUV. Curious, Ben gets a little closer and sees it’s a WO WITH DARK HAIR. Matt gets in the Woman’s car and they immediately kiss and then kiss again and again.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Dumbstruck. He’s now dangerously close to the Woman’s car He slows down as Matt and the Woman separate, go back for more kiss, then drive off.

dialogues.speaker: PAIGE
dialogues.text: -- Is it Ben? Is it that front door?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Yeah, it is. Good girl. Ben can’t process what he just witnessed. He’s momentaril frozen. A car honks at him. Snapping to, he turns at the corner, looks in the rear view and sees Paige nodding off Ben pulls over, parks under a tree, tries to compute what just saw. Just then, a TEXT FROM JULES. He looks at his phone:

dialogues.speaker: TEXT
dialogues.text: How’s it going? Thank you! :) Ben's finger trembles but he manages to type back: A-OK. Then, adds an exclamation point before shutting his eyes a quick sec. His heart races, he can’t seem to focus. And then he hear something familiar. He looks up at the rear view and sees Paige is snoring. He looks at her sweet little face and feels a new found pain just at the sight of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben walks up the steps carrying a sleeping Paige. Matt op the door in a new change of clothes.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Awww. Thanks so much Ben. INT. PAIGE’S ROOM Ben lies Paige on her bed then Matt pulls up her covers. Matt turns toward Ben and finds Ben staring at him. Matt wonders why.  102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben crosses to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Can I get you something before you go? Cup of coffee, bite of something to--

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I’m good. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: How was she? Didn’t give you any trouble?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: She was perfect. She wasn’t feeling so great at the party so we... we left a little early then she fell asleep so I just hung out in the car and let her get ina nap. She slept good...

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: So nice of you. Thank you. Matt gets a text, takes out his phone, quickly looks at i returns the phone to his pocket. Looks up guiltily.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You seem like you're feeling more with it...

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: (hates lying) Yeah. Just needed a little downtime, I guess or maybe I wasn’t that sick, I don’t know. (Ben nods...) Ben, I wanted to ask you, what’s your take on this whole CEO thing? You’re more on the inside than I am.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I know Jules is trying to do right by everybody - the investors, the company... you... She’s got a lot on her shoulders. The pressure’s unreal.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Am I wrong to hope it happens? I mean, I want what she wants but you know what it’s like around here -- (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATT (cont'd) we don’t see her enough. Maybe this will fix that.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: A CEO's going to fix... what’s going on here, Matt? (Matt stops cold) Whatever she decides... (wipes his eye...) I just, I want it to be good for her, I want her to be happy. (eyes landing on Matt)

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Of course. Ben nods, his eyes steady on Matt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben wends his way through the office, pre-occupied, looki bit wan. He passes Lewis who is clean shaven, got a bit o hair cut and is wearing a tie and carrying a briefcase exactly like Ben’s. Ben doesn’t notice.

dialogues.speaker: LEWIS
dialogues.text: Benjamin, dude, what do you think? (Ben’s not sure what he means ) Of my man look. I got so many compliments, it’s crazy. And check this out... (holds up briefcase) --found it on e-bay. You're right, total classic.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (half-hearted) You look awesome, kid. Across the office, Ben notices a small crowd has gathered sing “Happy Birthday.” He sees Jules is part of the crowd smiling, singing. He takes a deep breath at the sight of her. Jules gives the Birthday Girl a hug, then spots Ben.

dialogues.speaker: BEN CLICKS ON HIS E-MAIL
dialogues.text: He has tons. His desk is now stacked with paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: JULES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: How'd it go? Jules leans on Ben’s desk, eating a piece of cake and han Ben a piece.  104.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You have a great kid, Jules. She was adorable.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Awww. Thank you so much for doing that. So -- you excited about going to San Francisco tomorrow? (Ben wipes his brow with his hankie, he’s having trouble having eye contact with Jules) You okay?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Oh, man, I hope you don’t have what Matt has.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I don’t.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Positive. (takes a small pill)

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Blood pressure. Take it everyday.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: You sure you’re okay ‘cause you don’t look like you. You’re all flushed. Why don’t you go see Fiona, the masseuse, and just chill for a little.

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: (walks by, notices Ben mopping his brow) What’s up? You okay Ben? You seem to be slightly malfunctioning. Ben rolls his eyes as Becky joins.

dialogues.speaker: JULES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Does he look right to you?  105.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Okay, thank you. I think we’re good here. Got a lot of work to do.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Is it his coloring?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Oh my God, you’re all nuts. I’ma hundred percent. lLet’s move on kids. Big day, lots to do.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Ben, if I’m giving you too much to do or wearing you out, please do not think you have to go with me to-

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: -- Jules, people my age get tired sometimes. That’s all this is.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: You're tired? That’s why you haven't looked at me once since I walked over here.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (turns to her) I'm looking at you. She realizes he’s looking at her for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Jules, Candice is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: If you don’t feel good later or tonight or... (Ben drops his head...) I’m just sayin’...I can go by myself tomorrow. I’m a big girl. I'll be fine. INT. PLANE - IN THE AIR —- THE NEXT DAY Ben and Jules in first class, both have work on their tra tables. Jules is on her iPad. Ben is staring at her. Bursting, but not talking.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: (finally, turns to him) Okay! Seriously. Ben! What - is- it!?!  106.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (giving up) You know, I’m a sensitive man. I don't look it, people don’t think that about me. But I am. Under all this man stuff that you so admire, I’m just a big bowl of mush.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: I know that.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Okay! (calming himself down)

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: That’s it? That’s what 24 hours of crazy comes to? That you’re a sensitive bowl of mush.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Jules. (almost tells her what he knows, changes his mind) Jules, what are we doin’ here? We got the day off. We’re travelin’ in first class. (starts packing up his papers) Let’s at least have a little fun.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Okay! That I get. She snaps her iPad case shut, calls for the Flight Attend

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules and Ben are mid-meal and getting refills on their w Jules is telling Ben a story and laughing so hard, she ca get the story out. Ben is dying laughing. Can’t catch his breath. He laughs, wiping away tears as Jules continues. LATER —- READY TO LAND Jules and Ben put their seats in the upright position. Ju takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Yeah. Just thinking, tomorrow I meet the guy who may become my boss. A lot of people have bosses right? Most people have bosses!  107.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Jules, it’s simple. If you think Townsend is going to be good for you and good for the company, then do it and if not...

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: -- Exactly. Just because I came here...

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Right.. Doesn’t mean....

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: (nods ) I agree. Do you think I can take a Xanex if I had two glasses of wine an hour ago?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I'd wait another couple of hours. Jules nods. As they prepare to land, Jules closes her eye kisses her fingertips, touches her eyes, nods her head, counts to four then mumbles something that ends in the wo Amen. Ben watches.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: It’s a thing I do when I land. We're good now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules has wet hair, she’s in the hotel robe and on her iP TV is on in the b.g.. Suddenly there’s a LOUD SIREN-LIKE BEEPING coming from the hallway. Jules looks up sharply. INT. BEN’S ROOM - SAME TIME - THE BEEPING CONTINUES Ben is asleep with an open book on his chest. His eyes po open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred or so Hotel Guests have gathered on the street dressed in everything from bath towels to tuxedos. Jules, her robe and wet hair, pushes through the crowd, relieved spot Ben walking toward her in his pj’s and robe.  108.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: This alarm going off is not a good omen about this guy. It’s a sign, Ben.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I'm pretty sure it’s not. You haven’t taken the Xanax yet.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: You told me to wait two hours. You travel with your own robe?

dialogues.speaker: HOTEL MANAGER
dialogues.text: Ladies and Gentleman, a smoke alarm went off in one of our rooms but the problem has been taken care of. Our sincerest apologies.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Yep. Two hundred people, 4 elevators. Definitely a sign. Iceberg ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben walks Jules to her room.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Thanks for escorting me back. Want to see my room? (Jules OPENS her door. Ben peeks in) I mean do you actually want to come in? I have a tea kettle, we could have tea... (then) I'm ridiculously nervous about tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules is pouring hot water into two mugs.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: You lie down, I know you’re tired and I‘1l sit in the chair. Ben catches the reflection of Jules's bare legs in the mi and looks away. He lies on the edge of the bed, one foot planted on the floor. Jules joins him on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I thought you were going to sit in the chair.  109.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Please let me be here. I need to lay down too. Ben shakes his head as Jules joins him on the bed. A bit awkward as they lie next to one another. JULES (cont'd) We don’t have to talk about work or anything...

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Alright. What should we talk about?

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Marriage? (Ben gets nervous, looks over at her) Will you tell me about your wife? She was great, right?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: She was. Molly was her name. She was a middle school principal. Beloved.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: So perfect. Long marriage?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Not long enough. Thirty-eight years.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Wow. What was that like?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You know when people say they want to grow old together? (Jules nods) Well, we did it. We met when we were 20. I was 20. She was 19. What was amazing was that she never really changed. That’s a hard thing to pull off. She handled life like it was easy. Always... even when it wasn’t.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: God, I envy that. (Ben smiles, Jules crosses to the Mini Bar) You hungry? We’ve got Gummy bears. Chocolate chip cookies. Pringles. She grabs everything and takes it all back to the bed.  110.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You know those are like $15 each.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Benjamin, I run a very big internet company. Let’s go crazy. So...

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (laughs, eating gummy bears) So..?

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: I got a weird one for you. Matt is cheating on me.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (almost choking) You know about this?

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: What does that mean? You know about it?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (hates saying this) I saw them together.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Oh, God. When?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Yesterday. I’m sorry. It was an accident that I saw them but I did.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Yesterday?! Oh, okay, so, it is still going on. (slinks down in bed) I was thinking maybe it was winding down. Fuck! Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: It’s okay.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Thanks. FUCK!!!

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: How long have you known?

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: For like 18 days. She’s a Mom at Paige’s school. It’s still so hard for me to grasp. I was in the kitchen making sandwiches and his phone was sitting there, he was (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULES (cont'd) upstairs with Paige and he kept getting all these texts. I don’t know why, but I read them. (starts to cry) It was not good. I thought my heart was going to stop. They had little nicknames for each other. She sent him a photo which is now forever implanted in my brain... I guess cell phones are going to do in all guys eventually.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Does he know you know?

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: No... because, honestly I’m not really ready to deal with it. I would like to be a little less devastated if that’s possible. It’s classic, though, isn’t it? The successful wife’s husband feels ignored, his manhood is threatened so he acts out. The girlfriend I guess makes him feel more like a man. Sometimes I think maybe I don’t know how to do the -- make him feel like a man thing, you know? And anyway, is that even what I’m supposed to do? I mean, that’s an exhausting endeavor.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Wait, wait wait. Hold on. You’re not actually taking the rap for any this, are you?

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: No. No! He’s doing something bad. No! Monogom-ish is not what I’m going for. I’m just trying to wait it out for a sec. I’m hoping it’s just a horrible lapse in judgment and not like, love -- and once he gets it out of his system, we'll be able to eventually be okay again. What do you think of that? (off Ben’s look) Clearly you don’t think that’s a possible thing.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: It would be unusual.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: I get not everybody could do that but everybody’s not us. I have hope for us ‘cause I believe he (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULES (cont'd) still loves me and we're going through a lot right now and... God, I wish all of your expressions weren’t so transparent. Some couples do survive these things. Anyway, there’s something to be said for getting through it. Putting value on us and not the affair. Also, I know you want to say something, here’s the last thing -- I don’t want to give up on him ‘cause I know him and I know he knows better. But I’m only human, so I’m obviously so mad at him... (tries to pull it together ) So much has happened to us so fast, maybe I was somehow even expecting this. You know he was the more successful when we started out...

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: No, didn’t know that.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Yeah. He was. He was a rising star... I’m sure this is why I’m even entertaining this whole CEO thing... thinking maybe it will let me get my life back on track but--

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: -- Oh, God, okay, that’s it! (makes the Time Out sign) I hate to be the feminist here, between the two of us, but you should be able to have a huge career and be brilliant without having to accept your husband is having an affair as some kind of payback.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Right on.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I mean it.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Me too. But such is life, my friend.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: No it isn’t. Not always. And I'm really mad at him too. Except I’m not so forgiving.  113.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: I’m not so forgiving. I’m saying I could potentially be forgiving. But don’t think I don’t feel what’s happening here. It’s crushing. And when I think of Paige...

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Oh, don’t...

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Also, I know if we got a divorce, he'd remarry, not necessarily to this girl, but someone and we know I’m not easy, so I could be like single forever which means and forgive me but I think about this sometimes in the middle of the night... (covers her face...)

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: What??

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: -- That I don’t want to be buried alone. Paige will be with her husband, Matt will be with his new family and I’1l be buried with strangers. I’1ll be in the single strangers section of the cemetery. Abhhhhh. Not that that’s a reason to stay together, that’s just a scary side bar...

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Okay, let’s take that one off your plate. You can be buried with me and Molly. I happen to have room. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: (so touched, tears streaming) Thank you. So much. And to think I didn’t even want to hire you...

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: The one time I don’t have my hanky.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: (wipes her eyes on the belt of the robe) I’m okay. You want to see what’s on TV? Just for a few minutes?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Yeah. I would...  114. Jules picks up the remote, clicks around and is relieved land on Gene Kelly and Debbie Reynolds dancing to “You We Meant For Me” from Singin’ in the Rain.
