They watch in silence at the optimism, innocence and youthful beauty on screen. Ben turns to Jules, sees her eyes are shutting. B watches the movie alone, happy to be lost in another worl INT. BARBER SHOP - THE NEXT A.M. Ben is getting a shave. His eyes go to the clock on the wall. It’s 9:30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben paces in front of a town car when he spots Jules, wal quickly out of the building, wearing sunglasses. He opens the back door of the car. She nods, gets in. Ben joins he in the backseat.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: To the airport?

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: The airport. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Did we like him?

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: (pulls out Purell) He said everything right. Said no one knows CTF like me. Said he doesn’t want to remove the soul of the company. (Ben opens his palm for a squirt of Purell) He said he doesn’t have a plan, wants to watch us and see what works. He was polite, he was respectful, he was super smart and I hired him.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Seriously? You did it in the room?

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: He told me to sleep on it and we’ll talk tomorrow but I told him the job was his. We shook hands on it. (then) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULES (cont'd) You know if we disagree on something... he’s the tie breaker.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Of course. He’s the CEO.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Matt’1l be happy. Ben lowers his window a couple of inches, turns toward th fresh air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt bounds down the stairs as Jules ENTERS. He kisses he hello.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Hey. You smell minty.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I just made mint tea. So? Yes? No?

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: I did it. I liked him a lot and I offered him the job.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Wow. Really? (Matt hugs her) Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Yeah. I think it’1ll be good for us. Do we have like any real booze? Like vodka or something?

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STAIRS
dialogues.text: Jules sits on the stairs. Matt joins her with two glasses Vodka.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Did good for us mean CTF or us?

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: You and me us. If someone else can call some of the shots at work, then maybe we can get back to where we were 18 months ago. They say you can’t get the genie back in the bottle, but we can try. Right? Matt turns to her but neither says a word.  116.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules lies in the bathtub, wiped out. She looks over at t sink, sees two toothbrushes in a cup, then to the back of door -- Matt’s robe hangs on the hook. She shuts her eyes for a sec, rubs her chest, tries to calm her breathing. A few of Paige’s bath toys sit on the tub ledge. Jules pick up a little frog, winds it up, places it in the tub and watches it flip around. Her eyes fill with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt lies across the bottom of the bed, wishing his life wasn’t crumbling. He sits up, faces the closed bathroom door, wants to do the right thing, but can’t seem to get and go in there. His phone pings - he has a text. He doesn’t look at it. EXT. BEN’S HOUSE - EARLY A.M. A Cab pulls up. Jules steps out and walks up the front pa just as Davis EXITS in a suit, carrying a brief case.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Wait, you live here?

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: Oh. Hi! Yeah, Ben’s been putting me up ‘til I find a place. Should I tell him you're here?

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: That’s okay, I’11l knock. Jules KNOCKS on the FRONT DOOR and in a sec, Fiona answer JULES (cont'd) (stunned) Fiona??

dialogues.speaker: FIONA
dialogues.text: (surprised) Hi Jules. Come on in. Fiona opens the door and we find Ben, clearing the breakf dishes. FIONA (cont'd) I’m just on my way to work, I’1l let you two talk. Fiona grabs her tote, crosses to Ben, gives him a kiss on cheek. Ben smiles softly as she heads out.  Now alone with Ben, Jules remains in the Living Room, a distance away.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Wow. You and Fiona. Who knew?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: She's a great gal. She surprised me last night. Brought over dinner. It’s... brand new.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Congrats. I love her. Jules pauses, putting all that together, then rolls on. JULES (cont'd) So, I was ready kind of early today. Since about four... and Matt and Paige left an hour ago for a field trip so thought I’d come by, hope that’s okay. Just wanted to say I slept on it, I haven't called Townsend yet but I still think it’s the right thing to do.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I didn’t sleep so well myself.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Over this?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: You remember the day I drove you to the warehouse? You were giving me the wrong directions and...

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: I remember.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Okay, well, I stood in the back and watched you show the workers how to fold and box the clothes. I knew then, that was why CTF was a success. No one else is ever going to have that kind of commitment to your company Jules. To me, it’s pretty simple. CTF needs you and if you don’t mind me saying - you need it. Someone may come in with more experience than you, but they’re never going to know what you know. I never had something (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEN (cont'd) like this in my career. Not many people do. This big, beautiful, intricate thing that you created -- it’s a dream isn’t it? And you're going to give that up in the hopes that your husband will stop having an affair? I don’t see how that adds up. You should feel nothing but great about what you’ve done. Don’t let anybody take that away from you. (Jules wipes a tear from her cheek) I guess you came over here ‘cause you wanted to hear some of this...

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Yeah, I did. And maybe also ‘cause you're my... (she can’t quite say it)

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Intern.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: I was going to say... (mumbles ) Intern/Slash/Best friend, but no need to get all sentimental even though we could potentially be buried together. Can’t get closer than that and I think it’s moments like this when you need someone who you know you can count on. So thank you for that. (Ben nods) I like your house so much by the way.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Thank you. They both take the time to think about what was just said BEN (cont’d) So. Shall we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben and Jules get off the elevator together. Just another day for everyone else. Becky, looking fresh and relaxed greets them, carrying an iPad.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Welcome back you two. Jules, got something cool to show you. (clicks on a Photo) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BECKY (cont'd) Do you remember taking a customer service call about a Bride whose bridesmaids’ dresses all showed up in grey and you had the Vendor remake them overnight and we put them on a plane and --

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: -- Yeah, yeah...Rachel!

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Check this out. Becky shows Jules a PHOTO of RACHEL and her BRIDESMAIDS l up in their Pink Dresses.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: The silk chiffon Antoinette dress. They look beautiful. Jules and Ben arrive at their cubicles. There’s a huge arrangement of Peonies on Jules's desk. She hopes they're from Matt.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Also, these just arrived from Ted Townsend. Here’s the card.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: (reading the card) Get me Townsend’s number will you? Ben watches Jules then checks his watch. Jules's PHONE RI JULES (cont'd) This is Jules. Hey Alonzo, what's up? Okay, uh-huh, do we need that many? Jules feels someone standing over her. Looks up. It’s Mat He looks like he may have run to get here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules and Matt stand in the Conference Room.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Don't do this for me, Jules. Please. Do what feels right for you.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Oh, God. I want to continue running my company Matt -- you gotta know that.  120.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Then do it. I don’t want you to be unhappy.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: I’m already unhappy. That came out too fast to take back.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Because of me? She looks at him in a way that reveals what she’s been go through. His eyes fill with tears.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Is it almost over ‘cause I don’t know how much longer I can --

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: It is over. I love you Jules and I don’t know how to say this any better than to tell you how deeply sorry I am. I’m so ashamed of myself and what I did to us... I will do so much better at this. If you'll let me. Jules openly cries now. Matt waits for her response, not sure what to do.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Know what would be good? If you carried a handkerchief.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I’1l buy some. A long look at one another. So much to say...

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Okay... And through her exhaustion and tears, the smallest of smi and a nod make their way through.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Thank you... (wiping away his tears) Have you called Townsend yet because if I ever met anyone who didn’t need a boss -- it was you.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: -- I was just about to call him and tell him I changed my mind. I (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULES (cont'd) mean, we’re good here. We’ll make it. I’m gonna make sure we make it.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: Good. And maybe you could offer him the job of COO, under you... let him make the trains run on time and report to you.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: He won’t take that.

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: But somebody will.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: (wiping her tears) Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: MATT
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Jules, but I gotta get back to the field trip. I’m in charge of snacks and... Jules nods and Matt hesitates then hugs her in a way that finally relaxes them both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jules quickly zigzags around the desks, arriving at Ben’s desk. He’s not there.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Becky, where’s Ben?

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Not sure. Said he’s taking the day off. INT. FIONA’S ROOM - DIMLY LIT Someone is in the massage chair. The door opens, Jules sticks her head in.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Fiona, do you know where Ben is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben’s Tai Chi group, all in sync, move slowly toward the right, arms raised. Ben is among them. Jules approaches. Ben doesn’t see her at first. She joins the group, standi awkwardly near Ben.  122.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: (whispers ) Sorry to interrupt. Ben motions for her to be silent, then to get next to him She does.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (whispers ) Extend your left arm, Jules. Bend your knees, breathe and relax. (Jules drops her shoulder bag, tries it) For inner balance...

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: (not quite getting it) Am I doing it right?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Almost. Jules tries harder.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: I have something good to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Tell me when we’re done.

dialogues.speaker: JULES
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Breathe deeply, Jules... And as Jules follows Ben and tries her best to achieve in balance, CAMERA DRIFTS and slowly we: FADE OUT.
